transcript.title: New York v. Federal Energy Regulatory Commission

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We'll hear argument now in number oh oh five sixty-eight, New York versus Federal Energy Regulatory Commission and the companion case, oh oh eight oh nine Mr. Malone.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
From nineteen ten until the issuance of the FERC decision under review, all fifty States regulated transmissions of electricity to retail customers.

You didn't see the rates, terms, and conditions of that regulation, with a few exceptions, because the rates were bundled in bills that charged customers for all of the elements of retail service which are basically the energy itself, or the commodity, its delivery over transmission high voltage and distribution low voltage lines, and metering and billing.

The issue in this case is whether the nineteen thirty-five Congress intended the Federal Power Commission, now FERC, to displace the State laws that required that regulation from nineteen ten until nineteen ninety-six if the commodity, the energy not the transmission, but the commodity is unbundled from the retail customers' bills.

The FERC, while conceding that unbundling was never contemplated by the nineteen thirty-five Congress, nonetheless has taken the position that if the commodity comes out of the bill, in order to give the customer knowledge to effect a choice to buy energy from a utility or a non-utility, then the transmission, although it still remains bundled with other elements and is never shown on the bill, except in the State of California, becomes a new and separate service and that that transmission is subject to preemption so that the States have to leave the scene...
for only FERC...
What if there, what if there...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: were no statute at all? And , do you think that under the Commerce Clause, with today's multi-state grids for transmission of power, that the States could have directly regulated energy transmission as a separate service?

I don't think there's any question, Your Honor, that under today's Commerce Clause jurisprudence, the States would be able to regulate retail deliveries over transmission facilities, particularly within their own States.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But the statute does give the FERC jurisdiction over the transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce.
Exactly.
attempting to fill...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: we didn't have these interstate grids, and isn't it conceivable that you could have a power company producing power within a State and distributing it to customers within the State, everything totally intrastate? That may have been a common occurrence at the time the statute was passed.
Well, Your Honor, the rate of interaconnection[:interconnection] from nineteen twenty to nineteen thirty-five was actually greater than the rate of interconnection that we have seen since.
Now that, that...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: are you saying o- one o- either of these two things? Either transmission regardless of the rate at which it is billed is is not essentially interstate commerce, or are you saying that you simply cannot read the act to pick up that activity in interstate commerce?
I'm saying that the l- the latter with with one caveat.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: So, you, w- do you admit then that th- that it is interstate commerce.
It clearly is subject to regulation by Congress if it wants to.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Okay.

We don't need th- the States do not need to get into the question of which transmissions are in interstate commerce and which aren't in order to preserve its jurisdiction over retail transmissions because Congress wanted the States to be able to continue to regulate retail transmissions.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: w- w- This is what I don't understand.
Why isn't...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: why isn't that the way to look at it rather than...
Be- Because the th- a- as the Colton case held, there's a there's a bright line here between retail and wholesale.
said.
All right.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But you you seem to concede and I don't see why you do it that the right to regulate transmission includes the right to regulate sale.
No, we we we don't.
We don't concede that.
What what I'm saying is that when unbundles when one unbundles transmission, the States don't lose it, even if it's out there by itself, if it's part of retail.
L- Let Let me give an example.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: depend on what sale means? If it's sale of the commodity, it says, sale of such energy at wholesale in interstate commerce.
Because when le- le- let's go back to nineteen thirty-five, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: bill, you mean the bill that the customer gets.
Yes.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Okay.

Now now, now this Court has said many time, Your Honor, your, times, Your Honor I know, Justice Scalia, you don't like reference to legislative history, but you do accept ref- reading provisions in harmony.
Those prov-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Where do we find these?
They ar- they are I'm sorry, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And whereabouts? Is i- do we Starting with six fifty-two A?
The I d- I don't have the the the page reference off the top of my head.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, you're you're summarizing a st- a series of statutory provisions in those words?
No.
over...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: give us the USC cites of those things? I, It's crazy when you people who spend your whole life in this one statute use the old the old numbers instead of the United States Code numbers.
You're talking about sixteen USC eight twenty-four A and B. Right?
That's correct.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: You're talking now about section A?
Yes, Your Honor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, just on that, is it the case that if in nineteen thirty-five Duke Power owns generating facilities in West Virginia, owns lines from West Virginia to North Carolina, and owns a distribution company in North Carolina, all one company, does the FPC have any jurisdiction at all in your opinion?
If there's a sale for resale...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: No, no no.
No.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you're saying.
The the, there is a case in nineteen thirty-four at two PUR second, where it's it's almost your iden- your hypothetical.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: All right.
That's correct.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: That's your argument.
Yes.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Okay.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mist-, Mr.
Malone, it...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: would seem to...
is that you're done?
I just wanted to add, Justice Breyer, that if you look at two oh six D, that calls on FERC to provide costs in your hypothetical...
from West Virginia to the North Carolina...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Then I would say if that's your argument, the response to that argument will be this is an unforeseen case in thirty-five, the possibility of Enron supplanting Duke, and it's close enough to wholesale sales.
If Enron supplants Duke and sells directly to a retail customer, it's going to be purchasing electricity, selling retail, over a delivery system that Enron does not own.
May I ask you one...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: question about the words in the statute? The statute uses an and.
Not quite, Your Honor.
Mr. Malone, could I come back...

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to Justice Ginsburg's earlier question...
which...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: focused on section eight twenty-four B two, which says that the provisions shall not apply to any other sale of electric energy.
Including the transmission.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Including the transmission.
Your Honor, I think...
that is a valid reading of the statute.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It's up to you.
Your Honor, we have situations in New York State, for example, where we have, FERC has regulated ha- curtailments u- over transmission systems.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Very well, Mr. Malone.
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
from the rules of the road.

text_blocks.text: just chose, in its discretion, not to regulate them?

It said that the transmissions should not be considered within the interstate transmission clause giving FERC jurisdiction over interstate transmissions, but rather, in the case of transmissions bundled with retail sales, should be considered part of the bundled retail sale.
said...

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

I think FERC made a jurisdictional mistake and I think the DC Circuit...
It misconstrued its statute. It didn't simply withdraw its hand. It misconstrued the act.
Yes.
transmission and that it should, therefore,
solve the problem that it foun-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: In your view, if FERC does have jurisdiction of this this part of the problem, must it exercise that jurisdiction or can it allow the States to regulate?
What it must do under section two oh six, which is section eight twenty-four E, is cure the undue discrimination that it found.
Well, then it's...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: pretty much a Pyrrhic victory for you if you persuade us that the the s- CADC was wrong in saying it was just a policy choice, it was a jurisdictional decision.

I'm hoping that what I had was a Pyrrhic defeat in the in the in the DC Circuit and that and that FERC, once told that it has jurisdiction, and having recognized that it has the obligation to cure undue discrimination, will exercise that jurisdiction properly.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We we usually have cases in which the agency is alleged to go too far.

Well, actually in the Louisiana Power and Light case, which we cite a- and think is very much in point here, which arises under the same parallel provisions of the Natural Gas Act, FERC's initial position was that it I believe FERC's initial position was that it did not have jurisdiction to regulate bundled direct retail sales of o- o- of gas and that that included u- u- a a lack of jurisdiction over the transportation of that gas.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I guess th- what would , suppose FERC says or suppose I read it as saying, since you're whipsawing them between you and New York, look, in nineteen thirty-five yours is the case where Congress would have never dreamt they had jurisdiction.

What happened in nineteen thirty-five was that, recognizing that interconnection was coming, Congress granted FERC jurisdiction over transportation of electric energy in interstate commerce without limitation.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It gave them, without limitation, authority over transportation of energy, but not without limitation authority over sale of energy.
Isn't that an essential part of your argument? Well, where does it where does it...
the States have plenary power to regulate who may serve their retail customers and at what rates and at what and on what other terms and conditions.
What do you mean sa-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: take into account? I thought you're saying that that FERC has the power to determine a a a component of the retail sale.
It has the power to...

determine the the cost of transmission of electricity insofar as that and and and and that may be one of the costs that the retail utility i- incurs for which the retail utility has the right under State law to recover.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: That's right.
the transmission...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: has authority to regulate the the wholesale sale.
sale. I mean, yeah, but transmission...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: by the statute, as I read it, is separated from sale.
Where are you reading f-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I'm reading from B one.
It's eight twenty-four...
Six, sixteen. Yes.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: The provisions of this chapter shall apply to the transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce.
That's...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: drawing a dichotomy between transmission and sale.

And we have stressed whereas the s- the the the nine States have tried to blur this distinction, we have stressed the distinction between FERC's jurisdiction over transmission and FERC's jurisdiction over wholesale sales.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Must be taken into account.
is i- i- is, n- does not encroach upon the States' retail sale authority, but it is something that the States must respect in setting retail rates, so FERC's regulation of the cost of transmission.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But FERC's regulation of the cost of of of interstate transmission at wholesale comes about not because of its authority over the transmission of el- of electric energy, but because of its authority over the sale of electric energy at wholesale.
to take that into a-
I, Yes. I don't I don't agree with that. that that...
that is that is the statutory...
Yeah. The statute...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: says, shall apply to transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce.
Well it says, doesn't it?
and, two,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the sale of electric energy at wholesale in interstate commerce, which you take to be a second grant of authority.
Yes, and the basic...

The basic structure of our argument is that just as your opinion for the Court, Justice O'Connor, explained in Nantahala, that m- the States must take into account the wholesale cost of energy, so the States can be required to to take into account FERC's regulation of transmission...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: What difference does it make whether the transmission component is bundled or unbundled at retail sale?
We don't think it should make any because transmissions , whether for wholesale or retail, whether bundled or unbundled, compete for use of the interstate grid.
Can you sell at...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: retail in States which are which are un- bundled?
Absolutely not.
What we want...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: then why is there then why is there a problem?

Because what we want the right to do is to use the transmission system through those States without the retail the traditional monopoly utility that owns the facilities in those States being able to hog those facilities for its own use and keep us off the road.
let me try an example.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: trying to reach retail...
Even though we're not trying to reach retail customers, we may be trying to sell e- energy to the utility in Minneso- in in in in in Wisconsin.
The traditional...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: then that wholesale sale can be regulated.

The wholesale sale can be regulated, but the traditional utility in Minnesota, which owns the facilities and mostly makes bundled retail sales to its customers in Minnesota, can say, our bundled retail sales are not subject to FERC's OATT.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: very surprised that FERC is saying that they have no jurisdiction over that.
of this statute, isn't it?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And if B puts something up on those lines that blocks the transmission, I'm very surprised that FERC would say they don't have jurisdiction to stop...
Well, we were a...
little surprised too.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But that's what this case is about in your view.
From our s- from our standpoint, that's what our side of this case is about.

transmission,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: both interstate and intrastate.

All that I'm asking the Court to say is that FERC has the ability to a-, the jurisdiction to apply its general open access transmission tariff not only to our sales a- f- at wholesale and to s- but but also to the bundled retail sales that compete with us for use of the o- of the transmission grids.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

transmission.

e- Particular regulation.

Yes.

the ideal example is the curtailment example.
customers, and that's...

text_blocks.text: Government to determine which which will be the emergency users and the preferred users in each State and locality.
We want the Federal Government...
to regulate the transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce, and that has become a more complicated problem than it was in nineten thirty-five.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

It's it's it's a lesser percentage now than it used to...
on average it's now about it's now about ten percent.

It is.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I don't even see how this works.
Well, in order to have the the the electricity flows...
the the the power flows generally over the system, but...

but in order to have the right to turn on, to ramp up your generator to to produce some additional electricity which your customer a- a- a- at a time when your customer is going to take electricity off the system at some other point, y- you need to have a contractual arrangement or other right to do that.
Justice.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mr. Kneedler, we'll hear from you.
Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

text_blocks.text: Mr. Kneedler, it it if I understand it correctly, it is i- the position of the agency hinges on the proposition that the the power conferred by by section eight twenty-four to regulate the transmission of electrical energy includes includes the power to regulate the sale of the transmission of elec- electrical energy.
Isn't that what...
the sale of the transmission,
The sale of the transmission.
does not in- what it does not include is the retail sale.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Now, if that were true, it seems to me that eight twenty-four B one, instead of reading the way it does, should read this way, The provisions of this subchapter shall apply to the transmission of electric energy in interstate commerce which would include the sale of that transmission, right? And to the sale of the commodity portion of electrical energy at wholesale in interstate commerce.
Well th-
And but...

electric energy is the commodity.
FERC, that's been...

Because...
wholesale rate, just as the State could.

Yes, absolute-.
part of it.

Okay, and if I can...
